definition: to change shift/the next work shift/to relieve (a workman on the previous shift)/to take over the job
to exchange/to change (clothes etc)/to substitute/to switch/to convert (currency)
surname Ban
team/class/squad/work shift/ranking/CL:個|个[ge4]/classifier for groups

sentences.english: Is golden boards used to check the AOI machine before the inspection of each shift?
sentences.chinese: 在每次換班前是否用AOI機器檢驗鍍金板？

sentences.english: At 5 a.m., it was the earliest shift change in Arkansas.
sentences.chinese: 早晨5點鐘，這在阿肯色州是最早的換班時間。

sentences.english: The watchman of the storehouse will be relieved at 10 p.m.
sentences.chinese: 庫房的看守人將於晚上十點換班。

sentences.english: Their brothers in their villages had to come from time to time and share their duties for seven-day periods.
sentences.chinese: 他們的族弟兄住在村莊，每七日來與他們換班。

sentences.english: Cahill, the guard assigned to that shift, was friendly .
sentences.chinese: 被派換班的警衛卡西爾很夠朋友。

sentences.english: The guards are changed in the morning in the forecourt behind the railings.
sentences.chinese: 警衛是在前庭的欄杆後面完成每天早上的換班的。

sentences.english: Also, another bad time to go is change-of-shift time.
sentences.chinese: 另一個糟糕的就診時間是換班時間。

sentences.english: The day shift arrives [ arrive ] at eight o'clock.
sentences.chinese: 白班工人八點鐘來換班。

sentences.english: A: Please switch work shifts with me.
It's time for the watchmen to change off.
sentences.chinese: 警衛員換班的時間到了。

sentences.english: "There aren't others who can relieve you?" Tim says.
sentences.chinese: “沒有其他的人可以和你換班嗎？”蒂姆說。

sentences.english: And their brethren， which were in their villages， were to come after seven days from time to time with them.
sentences.chinese: 他們的族弟兄住在村莊，每七日來與他們換班。

sentences.english: "I'm commutin four hours a day, " he said morosely.
sentences.chinese: 一天光換班就要在路上花上四小時。
小王的換班班次在下午1點。

sentences.english: It's a great spot to watch the monthly changing-of-guards ceremony at the Istana.
sentences.chinese: 它是觀禮每月一次的總統府衛兵換班儀式的勝地。

sentences.english: Administrations changed, and political parties swapped control of the White House, but Gates remained.
sentences.chinese: 政府換班，政黨交替操控白宮，但蓋茨繼續留職。

definition: to raise a lantern and fight at night (idiom); fig. to work into the night/to burn the midnight oil
to be up to one's ears in work (idiom)/to be unable to attend to other things at the same time
to volunteer for/to offer to undertake
attendant on an airplane, train, boat etc
class timetable
caseworker/social worker
(of a pendulum) to stop swinging/(of work, production, activities etc) to come to a halt/to be suspended/to be canceled/shutdown/(sports) lockout
rush hour
to try to persuade sb to give up (their job, plans etc)
to hold a (business) meeting/to start negotiations
Five-Year Plan
timetable/schedule
domino effect/ripple effect
Dacun township in Changhua county 彰化縣|彰化县[Zhang1 hua4 xian4], Taiwan
audition/dress rehearsal/preview (of a theatrical performance)/dummy run
medical affairs
